person.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a human being, especially considered as someone with their own particular character
person.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: He was a very nice person, always pleasant and friendly.
The only person who really said anything helpful was Jack.
I like her as a person, but not as a boss.
I still know quite a lot of people in the village.
David was not the sort of person who found it easy to talk about his feelings.
person.translation[0].definitions[1].def: someone who is not known or not named
person.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The police are appealing for any person who was in the area at this time to contact them.
murder by person or persons unknown
All 115 persons on board were killed.
person.translation[0].note_box[0].items[: The plural of person  is usually people
There are 25 people in the class
There are 25 persons in the class
The plural persons is used in official English, for example in official notices, documents, or statements
All persons born in the United States are citizens of the United States
The maximum number of persons in each group is 14
person.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a person or group of people who have certain rights and duties
person.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: In Scotland, a firm is a legal person distinct from the partners of the firm.
